did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Southwest Folklore Center Field Recordings Collection, 1943-ongoing
did.abstract: Reel tape recordings produced by University of Arizona Folklore Committee from 1943 through 1978, and after 1979, by the Southwest Folklore Center. Predominately field recordings from southern Arizona, they include cowboy songs and music, oral history interviews and corridos. The collection also includes 12 studio master tape reels recorded by Mexican American singer Lydia Mendoza.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and Spanish.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Restricted. Users are required to use preservation cassette copies of the tape reels when available. An item level listing of all tape reels in the collection is available.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Southwest Folklore Center Field Recordings Collection (SWF 011). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The University of Arizona Folklore Committee, founded in 1943 by Frances Gillmor, collected songs, tales and general folklore from all parts of the state. Upon its dissolution in 1979 the Southwest Folklore Center was created and continued its activities of collecting folklore material in the field in Arizona, the Southwest, and northern Mexico. The field collection topics varied by interests and needs of the community as well as changes in the nature of folklore collecting. Major field collecting on reel-to-reel tapes was done in the areas of cowboy songs and poetry, and Tucson history.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into one series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection includes dubbed versions of selections from the Centerâ€™s Pre-1980 Sound Disc Collection as well as field recordings of the University of Arizona Folklore Committee. These include regional music such as Mormon hymns, cowboy songs, Mexican American music and corridos, Native American music, and fiddle and banjo tunes. Recorded interviews concern family life and traditions, home remedies, Native American languages, Tucson slang, and oral histories.

During 1974 and 1975, James S. Griffith collected field recordings while working for the Smithsonian Institution Office of Folk Life. Contributions of field recordings were made to the Bicentennial Festival of American Folk Life held in Washington, D.C., in 1976. The collection includes original copies of these tapes.

Recordings made after 1980 were collected by James S. Griffith in southern Arizona, and relate chiefly to cowboy music and songs, corridos, oral history interviews about Tucson history and family life, and the annual Wa:k Powwow All O'Odham Fiddle Orchestra Contest.

Griffith and Claire Rosenberg in Black Canyon City, Arizona. 1 sound tape reel, analog, 7 1/2 ips, 7 in.

did.abstract: Tapes contain program and songs from the Macedonian Baptist Church. Performing groups include: Macedonia Baptist Church Choir; Rising Star Baptist Church Choir; Ideal Baptist Church Choir; Pilgrim Rest Baptist Church Choir; Southside Baptist Church Choir; St. James Baptist Church Choir. The program continues on each tape... Song: Pass me not oh gentle Savior; Opening prayer: Reverend Hopkins; Congregational song: When all God's children; Macedonia Baptist Choir: I shall not be moved / While I'm on this Christian journey; Rising Star Baptist Choir: When Jesus comes / I have something in me; Ideal Baptist Choir: I'll rise again/Death can't keep me in the grave / Stop by; Pilgrim Rest Baptist Choir: Watching therefore/You shall wear [a] robe and crown / Every now and then / Altar Call; Congregation: He's sweet, I know / The more you give, the more he gives to you; Speaker: Rev. S.A. Dabner, moderator, Salt River Valley District Association; Southside Baptist Church Choir: I will never let go of his hand / It's another day's journey and I'm glad about it; St. James Baptist Church Choir: Just couldn't be contented / God never fails. Collected by James S. Griffith in Rillito, Arizona. 3 sound tape reels, analog, [7 1/2 ips], 7 in.

did.unittitle: Everett Brisendine, Cowboy stories and songs,
did.abstract: Tape 2 of 3 was recorded at Brisendine's house, Chino Valley, AZ., and includes poems and stories... Everett [Brisendine] says -- Cowboy dream -- This old house -- My gun wouldn't shoot -- Hackberry Slim Johnson story -- Bank Robbery in Clarksdale [by the] Nelson brothers, 1928 -- T-ranch working reminiscences -- Shipping cattle to California, 1928 -- Rex, King of the Wild Horses and a story about being accused of robbing the Clemenceau bank, 1932 -- Story about McCabe, AZ., 1936...Transcript available in 82.1/R.2.T. Collected by James S. Griffith in Chino Valley, Arizona. 1 sound tape reel, analog, [7 1/2 ips], 7 in.

did.unittitle: Everett Brisendine, Cowboy stories and songs,
did.abstract: Tape 3 of 3 was recorded at Brisendine's house, Chino Valley, AZ., and includes the second part of the story about working in McCabe, AZ., in 1936. Transcript available in 82.1/R.3.T. Collected by James S. Griffith in Chino Valley, Arizona. 1 sound tape reel, analog, [7 1/2 ips], 7 in.

did.unittitle: Kenny Williams and Joe Sousa, Interview,
did.abstract: Tape contains interviews with and cowboy stories by Williams and Sousa recorded at Sousa's house, Cactus Lane, Phoenix, AZ... Bee drive -- Open ledger -- The Castration of the Strawberry Roan -- The Salvation Army song -- I like my steak rare -- Story about asking for a raise, "Eat more" -- Trip to California -- Dude ranching stories -- Movie making -- Shipping cows story -- Burt Arnold's story , "I just brought your saddle back" (told by Joe Sousa) -- Collected by James S. Griffith in Phoenix, Arizona. 1 sound tape reel, analog, [7 1/2 ips], 7 in.

did.unittitle: Hyrum Brakefield, Interview,
did.abstract: Tape contains interview with and fiddle tunes by Brakefield accompanied by James S. Griffith on banjo... Lone star rag -- Three legged milk stool -- Tommy don't go -- Grey Eagle -- Mascot and Western Railroad... Transcript available in 82.5/R.1.T. Collected by James S. Griffith in Phoenix, Arizona. 1 sound tape reel, analog, [7 1/2 ips], 7 in.

did.unittitle: Marvin Bennett, Cowboy stories and songs,
did.abstract: Tape 1 of 2 contains interview with and cowboy songs performed by Bennett. The interview discusses his life as well as five years he spent singing at the Grand Canyon in the 1930's. Songs include: Cowboy's dream -- Platoria, pride of the plains -- Old Pard/Dude Wrangler -- Lord I've never bothered you (the story of a cowboy getting bit by a tarantula while staying with a sheep herder). Transcript available in 82.7/R.1.T. Collected by James S. Griffith in Mayer, Arizona. 1 sound tape reel, analog, [7 1/2 ips], 7 in.

did.unittitle: Marvin Bennett, Cowboy stories and songs,
did.abstract: Tape 2 of 2 contains a story told by Bennett, "Yavapai Pete" and a story about hearing the Indians pre-natally. Transcript available in 82.7/R.2.T. Collected by James S. Griffith in Mayer, Arizona. 1 sound tape reel, analog, [7 1/2 ips], 7 in.

Transcript, including music and words to "Arimas Valley Waltz" is available in 82.13/R.1.T. Collected by James S. did.unittitle: Gail Gardner, Interview,
did.abstract: Dubbed tape 1 of 2 contains interview with Gardner of Prescott, Arizona, collected for the Library of Congress Bicentennial Record Project. Poems include:The Syerry Petes (The Sierry Petes) and the Moonshine Steer... These poems appeared on the Bicentennial Record. "Moonshine Steer" was used by James S. Griffith and Tucson radio station, KUAT, for the 1982 program,"Built on a Slim Foundation of Fact: A Look at Cowboy Humor" (See 81.5/C.1). Transcript available in 82.22/R.1.T.. Collected by James S. Griffith and Dick Spottswood. 1 sound tape reel, analog, [7 1/2 ips], 7 in.

did.unittitle: Gail Gardner, Interview,

did.unittitle: Van Holyoak, Everett Brisendine, Marvin Bennett, Gail Gardner, and Dick Denny, Built on a slim foundation of fact: A look at cowboy humor,

did.unittitle: New Hope Baptst Church sing,
did.abstract: Tapes contains choir music performed by the New Hope Baptist Church choir, the Southside Presbyterian Church choir of Tucson, and the Gideon Baptist Church choir of Tucson. Program continues from reel to reel... New Hope Baptist Church choir: The Lord is my light / Praise ye the Lord /Up above my head (Laverne Falls, solo) / Salt of the earth (Denise Falls, solo) / We are blessed (Laura Fleming, solo) / I won't fear what man can do (Rose Walker, solo) / Leaning on the everlasting arms; Southside Presbyterian Church choir: I decided to make Jesus my choice / There is a brighter day ahead / Where could I go but to the Lord (James S. Griffith, solo) / I'll fly away (James S. Griffith, solo); Gideon Baptist Church choir: Rose Johnson, director / Sign me up (Angela Coleman, solo) / If you make a start, don't turn around (Dwight Hart, solo); Ken Warren Johnson: Prayer, Bible readings and sermon; Gideon Baptist Church choir: Ain't nobody can do me like Jesus / New name / Just keep the faith (Rose Johnson, solo)/ God be with you 'til we meet again. Collected by James S. Griffith in Casa Grande, Arizona. 4 sound tape reels, analog, [7 1/2 ips], 7 in.

did.unittitle: Earl Rogers, Johnny Whelen, Glenn Ohrlin, and Everett Brisendine, Southwest Folklore Center/Student Union Activities Board Cowboy Concert
did.abstract: Tape contains stories, songs and poems from a cowboy concert held at the University of Arizona Student Union Ballroom, sponsored by the Southwest Folklore Center and the Student Union Activities Board. The concert was hosted by James S. Griffith. Program was as follows-- Earl Rogers: Yavapai Pete / You ask me were I'm goin'/ Utah trail; Johnny Whelan: Flor de Capomos / Penas Clavadas; Everett Brisendine: Old Cowboys / Christmas in a winter camp; Glenn Ohrlin: Santa Fe trail / Here's to the bull that roams the wood; Earl Rogers: Happy Jack's / Mother, the queen of my heart; Everett Brisendine: Wild Horse / To a little lady. Transcript available in file 85.4/R.1.T. Collected by James S. Griffith at the Student Union Ballroom at the University of Arizona in Tucson, Arizona. 1 sound tape reel, analog, 7 1/2 ips, 10 in.

did.unittitle: Earl Rogers, Johnny Whelen, Glenn Ohrlin, and Everett Brisendine, Southwest Folklore Center/Student Union Activities Board Cowboy Concert
did.abstract: Tape 2 of 2 contains stories, songs and poems from a cowboy concert held at the University of Arizona Student Union Ballroom, sponsored by the Southwest Folklore Center and the Student Union Activities Board. The concert was hosted by James S. Griffith. Program was as follows-- Glenn Ohrlin: Reincarnation; Earl Rogers: When it's roundup time in Texas /Wild Buckaroo; Johnny Whelan: El Palomito / Juan [Marta?]; Everett Brisendine: Choctaw / In memory of a pardner; Glenn Ohrlin: High toned dance / Frost on the cowboys tarp; Earl Rogers: Little Joe, the wrangler /Empty cot in the bunkhouse tonight; Johnny Whelan: Mothers don't let your babies grow up to be cowboys / El Chubasco; Everett Brisendine: Old timers /Unsung heroes of the West; Glenn Ohrlin: Lee's Ferry. Transcript available in file 85.4/R.2.T. Collected by James S. Griffith at the Student Union Ballroom at the University of Arizona in Tucson, Arizona. 1 sound tape reel, analog, 7 1/2 ips, 10 in.

did.unittitle: 2nd Annual All Tohono Oâ€™Odham [Old Time] Fiddle Orchestra Contest, Wa:k Pow Wow,
did.abstract: Tapes contain program recorded at the Second Annual Wa:k Pow wow Old Time Tohono Oâ€™Odham Fiddle Orchestra Contest. Performing bands include: the Lester Varvages Band, the Phillip Miquel Band, the Edmund Wilson Band, the Herbert Martinez Band, and the San Simon Old Great Time Band. Mike Enis hosts the concert in English and Tohono Oâ€™Odham. A short announcement is made by James S. Griffith. Each group performed a polka, a two-step (choti) and a mazurka. Transcript and related material is available in file 85.5/R.1.T and 85.5/R.1.T. Collected by James S. Griffith and Angelo Joaquin, Jr. at Wa:k Pow Wow at San Xavier Mission in Tucson, Arizona. 2 sound tape reels, analog, 7 in.

did.unittitle: Frank Shinn, Interview,
did.abstract: Tape contains an interview with Shinn regarding his work during World War II as a United States Marine Corps Recruiter. Shinn recruited Navajo Indians in Arizona to be part of the First 29 Navajo Code Talkers for the Marines. Transcript available in file 89.22/R.1.T. Collected by Zonnie Gorman. 1 sound tape reel, analog, 7 in.

did.unittitle: Eugene Crawford, Interivew,

Transcript available in file 90.6/R.1.T. Collected by Zonnie Gorman at the University of New Mexio in Gallup, New Mexico. 2 sound tape reels, analog, 7 in.

did.unittitle: Eugene Crawford, Interivew,
did.abstract: Tape contains interview with Gorman as he describes boot camp, development of the Navajo code, battle experiences, being wounded and his eventual recovery during World War II as part of the United States Marine Corps First 29 Navajo Code Talkers. Transcript available in file 90.6/R.3.T. Collected by Zonnie Gorman at the University of New Mexio in Gallup, New Mexico. 1 sound tape reel, analog, 7 in.

did.unittitle: Dean Wilson, Interview,

Collected by Zonnie Gorman at the University of New Mexio in Gallup, New Mexico. 2 sound tape reels, analog, 7 in.

did.unittitle: Les Keith, Interview and banjo tunes,
did.abstract: Tape contains vocals and banjo tunes performed by Keith... Bound to ride -- Robber settler -- Shortnin' bread -- Hobo Bill's last ride -- TB blues -- Blind lemon song/Matchbox blues/Old colored man blues. Collected by James S. Griffith in Tucson, Arizona. 1 sound tape reel, analog, 7 1/2 ips, 10 in.

did.unittitle: Les Keith, Interview and banjo tunes,
did.abstract: Tape contains interview and banjo tunes performed by Keith... songs include: Cluck old hen -- Sally Johnson -- Cacklin' hen/Old hen cackled. Collected by James S. Griffith in Tucson, Arizona. 1 sound tape reel, analog, 7 1/2 ips, 10 in.

did.unittitle: Les Keith, Interview and banjo tunes,
did.abstract: Tape contains vocals and banjo tunes performed by Keith. Collected by James S. Griffith in Tucson, Arizona. 1 sound tape reel, analog, 15 ips, 10 in.

did.unittitle: Tucson Old Time Fiddlersâ€™ Contest,
did.abstract: Contents and performer list available at 97.63/M.1. Taped recording of the Tucson Old Time Fiddlersâ€™ Contest, 19 February 1967, Tucson, AZ. Recorded on four reel tapes, with call numbers 97.63/R.1-4. Collected by James S. Griffith. 4 sound tapes, 7 in.

did.unittitle: Lydia Mendoza, Studio master reel tapes,
did.abstract: 12 studio master tape reels of songs recorded by Lydia Mendoza. Collected by James S. Griffith. 12 sound reels.

did.unittitle: Bill Hensley, Bill Hensley master reel tapes,
did.abstract: Collected by James S. Griffith and Keith Cunningham.

did.unittitle: Tucson Heritage Experience festival workshop stage, Reel tapes of the T.H.E. festival workshop stage,
did.abstract: 2 tape reel boxes (tape reels 4-5) are unlabelled and may be blank. Griffith did not check them before including them in the archives. SWFC has not obtained a release for this material. Reel tapes of the T.H.E. festival workshop stage, 1996, which includes the corrido contest; 5 reel tapes, 3 3/4 ips, half track, tails out, mono. Collected by James S. Griffith.

did.unittitle: 3 reel tapes of Tohono O'Odham music,
did.abstract: 3 Rivers Drum (pow wow); Desert Indian singers and dancers (Danny Lopez, leader); Joaquin Brothers waila band. Collected by John Crouch.
